intro: Neohumbertiella decaryi var. ambovombensis, commonly known as the Ambovombensis variety of the Decary's neohumbertiella, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique morphology, including its hairy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of eastern Madagascar. Its conservation status is critically endangered due to habitat loss and over-collection. This species holds significant ecological and botanical interest due to its restricted distribution and distinctive features.
